clinical_study.brief_title: Hypofractionated Radiotherapy and Concurrent Cisplatin for Head and Neck Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Hypofractionated Radiotherapy and Concurrent Cisplatin for Locally Advanced Head and Neck Cancer: A Feasibility Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the feasibility of hypofractionated radiation therapy and concomitant chemotherapy with cisplatin for locally advanced head and neck cancer in a high volume brazilian center.

detailed_description.textblock:
To evaluate if concomitant cisplatin and hypofractionated radiation therapy wold be feasible in a brazilian population.
Patients eligibility criteria:
older than 18 years old Biopsy proven squamous cell carcinoma of oropharynx, larynx and hypopharynx. Stage III an IV, with no distant metastasis. ECOG performance status 0-2. Adequate renal and liver function. Good status for radical treatment
Treatment considered feasible if:
1. Patient receive at least 90% of radiation dose (18 of 20 fractions of 275cGy)
2. Patients receive at least 3 of 4 weekly cycles of cisplatin (35mg/m2)
3. Treatment length up to 35 days.
4. Grade 4 toxicity lower than 25%

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the rate of patient who could complete the treatment.
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 years after patient accrual
primary_outcome.description: The treatment is considered completed when patients receive at least 90% of radiation dose (49,5Gy) with a cumulative cisplatin dose of 105mg/m2 or more (3 of 4 cycles) and the treatment duration is inferior to 35 consecutive days.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the rate of participants with treatment-related adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 5 years after patient accrual
primary_outcome.description: as assessed by investigators using the CTCAE v4.0 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of life according to the EORTC C30 questionaire and EORTC H&N 35 (evaluated together)
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency and intensity of symptoms as described by patients before treatment (baseline), at the end of treatment, 1 month, 7 months and after 1 year following the treatment.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 4 months after patient accrual
secondary_outcome.description: as determined by investigators using RECIST v1.1 criteria

arm_group.description: 20 fractions of 275cGy and concomitant weekly cisplatin 35mg/m2 x 4 cycles

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Biopsy proven squamous cell carcinoma of oropharynx, larynx and hypopharynx.
- Stage III an IV, with no distant metastasis.
- ECOG performance status 0-2.
- Adequate renal and liver function.
- Good status for radical treatment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other oncologic treatment before
- Distant metastasis
- History of previous malignancy
